page.title: 14Childrens' Games-Gloucester
page.content: Years ago children amused themselves by playing games with their friends outside in the street.They invented these games themselves.Games like{"Catch", "Hop-scotch","Kerby", {"British Bull dogs","Marbles","Hide {and Seek","Skipping","Tag",and lots more.Kerby is a ball game played across the street from one kerb to another. You throw a ball at the opposite kerb.If it hits you get one point.If it bounces back and you catch it you get two points.Nowadays we have toys to amuse us,but we still go out in the streets to play with our friends.And we still play some of the old games,but we have thought of many others to replace them. {Marbles -}Was played in Roman times The idea of the game was to make a circle of marbles.You roll your marble in,trying to hit the other marbles out
